about.summary: Functionalities to automatically generate interactive visualizations for popular statistical results supported by 'ggfortify', such as time series, PCA, clustering and survival analysis, with 'plotly.js' <https://plot.ly/> and 'ggplot2' style. The generated visualizations can also be easily extended using 'ggplot2' and 'plotly' syntax while staying interactive.

name: r-autoplotly
raw_recipe:
{% set version = "0.1.2" %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-autoplotly
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: autoplotly_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/autoplotly_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/autoplotly/autoplotly_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e835281e2536252814b805713a0ac693f782e130b4467a864d1bb8c493fc5f2a

build:
  number: 0
  skip: true  # [win32]
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - r-base
    - r-ggfortify
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-plotly

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ggfortify
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-plotly

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('autoplotly')"  # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('autoplotly')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/terrytangyuan/autoplotly
  license: Apache 2.0
  summary: Functionalities to automatically generate interactive visualizations for popular statistical
    results supported by 'ggfortify', such as time series, PCA, clustering and survival
    analysis, with 'plotly.js' <https://plot.ly/> and 'ggplot2' style. The generated visualizations can
    also be easily extended using 'ggplot2' and 'plotly' syntax while staying interactive.
  license_family: APACHE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - cbrueffer
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak

about.summary: Functionalities to automatically generate interactive visualizations for popular statistical results supported by 'ggfortify', such as time series, PCA, clustering and survival analysis, with 'plotly.js' <https://plot.ly/> and 'ggplot2' style. The generated visualizations can also be easily extended using 'ggplot2' and 'plotly' syntax while staying interactive.
